Package tuitionmanager

Class Roster

java.lang.Object
tuitionmanager.Roster
public class Roster extends Object
This is a class that maintains a resizing array of Student objects which represents and instance of a Roster object.

This class uses the Student class to define an array of Student objects which will be in the Roster instance.

Author:
Aryan Patel

  • Constructor Details

    • Roster

      Roster()
      Constructs a new Roster object which stores an array, roster, that contains Student objects. The size of the array is initialized to 2, and the size variable is set to 0, representing the total Student objects in the roster so far.

  • Method Details

    • grow

      private void grow()
      This method takes care of resizing the array of Student objects in a Roster. The capacity is increased by 4 in the new roster array. Contents from the old array are copied over and the reference to the old array is discarded.

    • sortInPlace

      private void sortInPlace(String type)
      This helper method takes care of sorting the roster array of Student objects by different comparators. The method uses and in-place insertion sort in order to sort the array in ascending order by either class standing, major and school, and the default order which is sorted by a student's Profile. A switch statement is used to alternate between the attributes being compared.

      Note: When comparing by Profile, the method uses the order of the attributes as follows: lname, fname, dob. When comparing by school and major, the methods uses the order of the school name first, and then the Major name.

      Parameters:
      type - String which contains the filter type to sort by ("standing", "school_major"), passing in anything else yields the default filter type

    • getRosterSize

      public int getRosterSize()
      This method gets the size of the roster array in a Roster object.
      Returns:
      int which contains the roster array size

    • getRoster

      public Student[] getRoster()
      This method gets the roster array from a Roster object
      Returns:
      array of type Student containing Student objects

    • find

      private int find(Student student)
      This method finds a given Student in the Roster array, and returns the index of its position. If the Student object is not in the array, then NOT_FOUND is returned.
      Parameters:
      student - Student object input that is the student which needs to be found
      Returns:
      int which represents the index associated with the student position

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Student student)
      This method check if the given Student object is present in the roster array. Returning a boolean value indicating whether the item is present. The method uses a linear search.
      Parameters:
      student - Student object input that is to be checked whether it is present in the roster array
      Returns:
      boolean which represents whether the given Student is contained in the roster array in Roster

    • add

      public boolean add(Student student)
      This method adds a given Student object into the Roster array if it is not already present. The method uses the contains() method to check if the given Student is in the roster array. If not, it proceeds to add the given Student object at the end of the array. If the array is full, we utilize the grow() method to resize the array before inserting. The method returns a boolean to indication whether the addition of the Student object was successful or not.
      Parameters:
      student - Student object input that is to be added into the Roster array.
      Returns:
      boolean which indicated whether the addition was successfully or not.

    • remove

      public boolean remove(Student student)
      This method finds and removes a given Student from the Roster array. The method returns a boolean indicating whether the object was found and removed successfully or not. The method first uses find() to check if the student is in the array. It returns if not found or continues to remove the student object from array if found. The method maintains the order of the Roster array after removal.
      Parameters:
      student - Student object input which is the student that needs to be found and removed
      Returns:
      boolean which indicated whether the operation to find and remove was successfull or not.

    • print

      public void print()
      This method takes care of sorting the Roster array using the student's Profile to compare, preparing the array to be printed.

    • printBySchoolMajor

      public void printBySchoolMajor()
      This method takes care of sorting the Roster array using the student's school and major to compare, preparing the array to be printed.

    • printByStanding

      public void printByStanding()
      This method takes care of sorting the Roster array using the student's standing to compare, preparing the array to be printed.
